page.title: 09Employment-Local area (2)
page.content: We found that the majority of people in our survey travelled less than 10 miles to work,but a few travelled between 20-50 miles a day,because there was nothing more suitable nearer home. Most of these people needed some form of special training for their present job.A few people worked short hours or did part time work,but most people who were working did a long,full day. Quite a few people had experienced unemployment at some time in their lives,but the lenght of time they were unemployed varied between 6 weeks and 3 years. We were interested to find that about 20% of those asked began work at less than 14years of age.About 10% began work at 21 years or older,but the majority began work when aged between 15 and 18 years.
